content: First, Zn (NO3)2·6H2O (1.62 g) methanol solutions and 2-methylimidazole (1.11 g) methanol solution were mixed and kept under magnetic stirring for 12 h. Then, the ZIF-8 precipitate was collected through centrifugation, washed with pure methanol solution, and dried at 80 °C for 12 h. Second, 0.16 g of ZIF-8 was added into 20 mL of methanol solution with vigorous ultrasonication for 30 min, then magnetic stirring for 20 min. Then, the ZIF-8, CoCl2 (0.35 g), and 2-methylimidazole (1.79) methanol solutions were mixed and magnetically stirred for 5 min. Finally, the mixture was transferred into an autoclave (50 mL) and kept at 100 °C for 12 h. The ZIF-8/ZIF-67 precursor was collected through the same process as that of ZIF-8.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials Synthesis

Preparation of the ZIF-8/ZIF-67 Precursor

First, Zn (NO3)2⋅6H2O (1.62 g) methanol solutions and 2-methylimidazole (1.11 g) methanol solution were mixed and kept under magnetic stirring for 12 h. Then, the ZIF-8 precipitate was collected through centrifugation, washed with pure methanol solution, and dried at 80 °C for 12 h. Second, 0.16 g of ZIF-8 was added into 20 mL of methanol solution with vigorous ultrasonication for 30 min, then magnetic stirring for 20 min. Then, the ZIF-8, CoCl2 (0.35 g), and 2-methylimidazole (1.79) methanol solutions were mixed and magnetically stirred for 5 min. Finally, the mixture was transferred into an autoclave (50 mL) and kept at 100 °C for 12 h. The ZIF-8/ZIF-67 precursor was collected through the same process as that of ZIF-8.
